documentation.text:
@dev Wrappers over Solidity's uintXX casting operators with added overflow
 checks.
 Downcasting from uint256 in Solidity does not revert on overflow. This can
 easily result in undesired exploitation or bugs, since developers usually
 assume that overflows raise errors. `SafeCast` restores this intuition by
 reverting the transaction when such an operation overflows.
 Using this library instead of the unchecked operations eliminates an entire
 class of bugs, so it's recommended to use it always.
 Can be combined with {SafeMath} to extend it to smaller types, by performing
 all math on `uint256` and then downcasting.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "SafeCast: value doesn't fit in 128 bits"

arguments.value: SafeCast: value doesn't fit in 128 bits

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "SafeCast: value doesn't fit in 128 bits"

documentation.text:
@dev Returns the downcasted uint128 from uint256, reverting on
 overflow (when the input is greater than largest uint128).
 Counterpart to Solidity's `uint128` operator.
 Requirements:
 - input must fit into 128 bits

natspec.details: Wrappers over Solidity's uintXX casting operators with added overflow checks. Downcasting from uint256 in Solidity does not revert on overflow. This can easily result in undesired exploitation or bugs, since developers usually assume that overflows raise errors. `SafeCast` restores this intuition by reverting the transaction when such an operation overflows. Using this library instead of the unchecked operations eliminates an entire class of bugs, so it's recommended to use it always. Can be combined with {SafeMath} to extend it to smaller types, by performing all math on `uint256` and then downcasting.

opcodes: PUSH20 0x0 ADDRESS EQ PUSH1 0x80 PUSH1 0x40 MSTORE PUSH1 0x0 DUP1 REVERT INVALID LOG2 PUSH5 0x6970667358 0x22 SLT KECCAK256 CALLER GT 0xA9 0x24 0xD3 0xB3 0xEE CALLDATACOPY 0xE6 DUP12 LOG1 0xA5 0x24 PUSH24 0x93FD4C3E2FCEAFDCBD2AD9662B6E0440FFA864736F6C6343 STOP MOD 0xC STOP CALLER
